text:
Honestly, this is about the only place in Singapore where I eat curry laksa nowadays. I'm sure there are others equally good but I'm happy to stick with this!
It's operated by a very industrious and courteous couple. All the brightly lit ingredients are neatly arranged, plenty to choose from, fresh and of decent size.
Crucially, their curry laksa is not watered down. It's not overly spicy and has a nicely balanced taste. I like it so much I don't bother going to look for alternatives.
Laksa Yong Tau Fu had great laksa taste but one ingredient I chose was not too great!
Underrated YTF! Love this place. Flavourful soup especially with the shallot oil.
Their normal soup base is very delicious, sweet but not too salty. Their laska base also good. Can see from their long queue every day. Pricing is also very friendly.

Their curry was so rich and lemak, probably the best I had from a YTF stall. However, they do not refry the deep fried items upon order, not only that they actually boiled it with the rest of the items which was quite a put off , the curry gravy somehow saves the day and still makes the dish overall enjoyable, but can't imagine how would those 'boiled' deep-fried stuffs taste like if you're just having it in a plain dry version.

Still I think this is a good place for YTF if you one that usually doesn't order the deep-fried stuffs.
